TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DownloadManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The download manager is a system service that handles long-running HTTP downloads.

remarks.para: The download manager is a system service that handles long-running HTTP downloads. Clients may request that a URI be downloaded to a particular destination file. The download manager will conduct the download in the background, taking care of HTTP interactions and retrying downloads after failures or across connectivity changes and system reboots.

Apps that request downloads through this API should register a broadcast receiver for #ACTION_NOTIFICATION_CLICKED to appropriately handle when the user clicks on a running download in a notification or from the downloads UI.
Note that the application must have the android.Manifest.permission#INTERNET permission to use this class.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual long AddCompletedDownload (string? title, string? description, bool isMediaScannerScannable, string? mimeType, string? path, long length, bool showNotification);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 AddCompletedDownload(string title, string description, bool isMediaScannerScannable, string mimeType, string path, int64 length, bool showNotification) cil managed

abstract member AddCompletedDownload : string * string * bool * string * string * int64 * bool -> int64 override this.AddCompletedDownload : string * string * bool * string * string * int64 * bool -> int64
MemberSignature.Usage: downloadManager.AddCompletedDownload (title, description, isMediaScannerScannable, mimeType, path, length, showNotification)

Docs.param: the title that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
the description that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
true if the file is to be scanned by MediaScanner. Files scanned by MediaScanner appear in the applications used to view media (for example, Gallery app).
mimetype of the file.

absolute pathname to the file. The file should be world-readable, so that it can be managed by the Downloads App and any other app that is used to read it (for example, Gallery app to display the file, if the file contents represent a video/image).
length of the downloaded file
true if a notification is to be sent, false otherwise
Docs.summary: Adds a file to the downloads database system, so it could appear in Downloads App (and thus become eligible for management by the Downloads App).
Docs.returns: an ID for the download entry added to the downloads app, unique across the system This ID is used to make future calls related to this download.

remarks.para: Adds a file to the downloads database system, so it could appear in Downloads App (and thus become eligible for management by the Downloads App).

It is helpful to make the file scannable by MediaScanner by setting the param isMediaScannerScannable to true. It makes the file visible in media managing applications such as Gallery App, which could be a useful purpose of using this API.

For applications targeting android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#Q or above, path must be within directories owned by the application {e.g. Context#getExternalFilesDir(String)} or if the application is running under the legacy storage model (see android.R.styleable#AndroidManifestApplication_requestLegacyExternalStorage android:requestLegacyExternalStorage), path can also be within the top-level Downloads directory (as returned by Environment#getExternalStoragePublicDirectory(String) with Environment#DIRECTORY_DOWNLOADS).
This member is deprecated. Apps should instead contribute files to android.provider.MediaStore.Downloads collection to make them available to user as part of Downloads.

format.a: Java documentation for android.app.DownloadManager.addCompletedDownload(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, long, boolean).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

the description that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
true if the file is to be scanned by MediaScanner. Files scanned by MediaScanner appear in the applications used to view media (for example, Gallery app).
mimetype of the file.

absolute pathname to the file. The file should be world-readable, so that it can be managed by the Downloads App and any other app that is used to read it (for example, Gallery app to display the file, if the file contents represent a video/image).
length of the downloaded file
true if a notification is to be sent, false otherwise
the original HTTP URI of the download
the HTTP Referer for the download

For applications targeting android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#Q or above, path must be within directories owned by the application {e.g. Context#getExternalFilesDir(String)} or if the application is running under the legacy storage model (see android.R.styleable#AndroidManifestApplication_requestLegacyExternalStorage android:requestLegacyExternalStorage), path can also be within the top-level Downloads directory (as returned by Environment#getExternalStoragePublicDirectory(String) with Environment#DIRECTORY_DOWNLOADS).

Docs.summary: Path to the downloaded file on disk.

remarks.para: Path to the downloaded file on disk.

Note that apps may not have filesystem permissions to directly access this path. Instead of trying to open this path directly, apps should use ContentResolver#openFileDescriptor(Uri, String) to gain access.
This member is deprecated. apps should transition to using ContentResolver#openFileDescriptor(Uri, String) instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Uri where downloaded file will be stored.

remarks.para: Uri where downloaded file will be stored. If a destination is supplied by client, that URI will be used here. Otherwise, the value will initially be null and will be filled in with a generated URI once the download has started.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: The URI to the corresponding entry in MediaProvider for this downloaded entry.

remarks.para: The URI to the corresponding entry in MediaProvider for this downloaded entry. It is used to delete the entries from MediaProvider database when it is deleted from the downloaded list.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Internet Media Type of the downloaded file.

remarks.para: Internet Media Type of the downloaded file. If no value is provided upon creation, this will initially be null and will be filled in based on the server's response once the download has started.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Provides more detail on the status of the download.

remarks.para:
Provides more detail on the status of the download. Its meaning depends on the value of #COLUMN_STATUS.
When #COLUMN_STATUS is #STATUS_FAILED, this indicates the type of error that occurred. If an HTTP error occurred, this will hold the HTTP status code as defined in RFC 2616. Otherwise, it will hold one of the ERROR_* constants.
When #COLUMN_STATUS is #STATUS_PAUSED, this indicates why the download is paused. It will hold one of the PAUSED_* constants.
If #COLUMN_STATUS is neither #STATUS_FAILED nor #STATUS_PAUSED, this column's value is undefined.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Current status of the download, as one of the STATUS_* constants.

remarks.para: Current status of the download, as one of the STATUS_* constants.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: The client-supplied title for this download.

Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Total size of the download in bytes.

remarks.para: Total size of the download in bytes. This will initially be -1 and will be filled in once the download starts.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 Remove(int64[] ids) cil managed
abstract member Remove : int64[] -> int override this.Remove : int64[] -> int

Docs.param: the IDs of the downloads to remove
Docs.summary: Cancel downloads and remove them from the download manager.
Docs.returns: the number of downloads actually removed

remarks.para: Cancel downloads and remove them from the download manager. Each download will be stopped if it was running, and it will no longer be accessible through the download manager. If there is a downloaded file, partial or complete, it is deleted.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
